titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Ruiz Case Office of Special Master Records, 1979-1992.

profiledesc.creation: Text converted by SPI Content Sciences Inc., July 2003.

change.item: Edited with XMetal 3 by Evan Hocker according to TARO 2 EAD 2002 Editing Instructions

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Ruiz Case Office of Special Master Records,

extref.corpname: Dolph Briscoe Center for American History, The University of Texas at Austin

did.abstract: Records relate to the work of the Office of the Special Master, created to oversee compliance with and implementation of the rulings of the federal courts in the landmark case of Ruiz et al. v. State of Texas.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ruiz Case Office of Special Master Records, 1979-1992, Dolph Briscoe Center for American History, University of Texas at Austin.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Some restrictions apply. Contact repository for further information.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is stored remotely; advance notice required for retrieval; contact repository for retrieval.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, pleadings, exhibits, motions, reports, orders, plans, and official publications relate to the work of the Office of the Special Master, created to oversee compliance with and implementation of the rulings of the federal courts in the landmark case of Ruiz et al. v. State of Texas. Also included are trial transcripts and exhibits in the Ruiz case from the law office of attorney William Bennett Turner, as well as a large body of prison medical testimony.
